summary: Jillian G. Goles, PA-C, initially faced a minimum one-year license suspension for allegations including altering her own medical records and self-prescribing controlled substances, requiring her to comply with the Maryland Professional Rehabilitation Program (MPRP). Her license was subsequently revoked because she repeatedly failed to comply with the terms of the consent order, specifically by delaying enrollment, missing appointments, and ultimately declining recommended treatment directed by MPRP.
